oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Clayton McMichen And His Georgia Wildcats - Unidentified radio program (first song Ida Red) - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of a radio show featuring 'Pappy' Clayton McMichen and his Georgia Wildcats, including Bernie Smith, James 'Doc' Eastwood, Ordie (likely Ordie Lee Day, unconfirmed), and George (possibly George Eaglelite, unconfirmed). Program likely recorded for WAVE, Louisville, KY, circa 1945-1955 (unconfirmed). Part 2: http://digi.countrymusichalloffame.org/cdm/singleitem/collection/musicaudio/id/799/rec/4
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Clayton McMichen; Georgia Wildcats
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Theme -- Opening statement (Clayton McMichen) -- Ida Red -- Clayton McMichen talks -- In The Blue Hills Of Virginia -- Clayton McMichen introduces Bernie Smith -- Nola -- Clayton McMichen talks -- Old Grey Bonnet -- Clayton McMichen talks -- Where Could I Go But To The Lord -- Clayton McMichen talks -- Johnson's Old Gray Mule -- Sugar In The Gourd
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WAVE (Radio station : Louisville, Ky.); McMichen, Clayton, 1900-1970; Georgia Wildcats (Musical group)
